trans-unit.source: Running Windows VMs for a 3-tier architecture | Blueprint | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Running Windows VMs for a 3-tier architecture | Blueprint | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: How to implement a multi-tier architecture on Azure, paying particular attention to availability, security, scalability, and manageability security.
trans-unit.target: How to implement a multi-tier architecture on Azure, paying particular attention to availability, security, scalability, and manageability security.

trans-unit.source: Running Windows VMs for a 3-tier architecture on Azure
trans-unit.target: Running Windows VMs for a 3-tier architecture on Azure

trans-unit.source: This article outlines a set of proven practices for running Windows VMs for an application with a 3-tier architecture.
trans-unit.target: This article outlines a set of proven practices for running Windows VMs for an application with a 3-tier architecture.

trans-unit.source: There are variations of 3-tier architectures.
trans-unit.target: There are variations of 3-tier architectures.

trans-unit.source: For the most part, the differences shouldn't matter for the purposes of these recommendations.
trans-unit.target: For the most part, the differences shouldn't matter for the purposes of these recommendations.

trans-unit.source: This article assumes a typical 3-tier web app:
trans-unit.target: This article assumes a typical 3-tier web app:

trans-unit.source: Web tier.
trans-unit.target: Web tier.

trans-unit.source: Handles incoming HTTP requests.
trans-unit.target: Handles incoming HTTP requests.

trans-unit.source: Responses are returned through this tier.
trans-unit.target: Responses are returned through this tier.

trans-unit.source: Business tier.
trans-unit.target: Business tier.

trans-unit.source: Implements business processes and other functional logic for the system.
trans-unit.target: Implements business processes and other functional logic for the system.

trans-unit.source: Data tier.
trans-unit.target: Data tier.

trans-unit.source: Provides persistent data storage.
trans-unit.target: Provides persistent data storage.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Azure has two different deployment models: [Resource Manager][resource-manager-overview] and classic.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Azure has two different deployment models: [Resource Manager][resource-manager-overview] and classic.

trans-unit.source: This article uses Resource Manager, which Microsoft recommends for new deployments.
trans-unit.target: This article uses Resource Manager, which Microsoft recommends for new deployments.

trans-unit.source: The following diagram builds on the topology shown in [Running multiple Windows VM instances on Azure][multi-vm].
trans-unit.target: The following diagram builds on the topology shown in [Running multiple Windows VM instances on Azure][multi-vm].

trans-unit.source: IaaS: multi-tier
trans-unit.target: IaaS: multi-tier

trans-unit.source: Availability Sets.
trans-unit.target: Availability Sets.

trans-unit.source: Create an [Availability Set][azure-availability-sets] for each tier, and provision at least two VMs in each tier.
trans-unit.target: Create an [Availability Set][azure-availability-sets] for each tier, and provision at least two VMs in each tier.

trans-unit.source: This approach is required to reach the availability [SLA][vm-sla] for VMs.
trans-unit.target: This approach is required to reach the availability [SLA][vm-sla] for VMs.

trans-unit.source: VNet.
trans-unit.target: VNet.

trans-unit.source: Every VM in Azure is deployed into a virtual network (VNet), which is further divided into subnets.
trans-unit.target: Every VM in Azure is deployed into a virtual network (VNet), which is further divided into subnets.

trans-unit.source: Create a subnet for each tier.
trans-unit.target: Create a subnet for each tier.

trans-unit.source: You should design subnets with functionality and security requirements in mind.
trans-unit.target: You should design subnets with functionality and security requirements in mind.

trans-unit.source: All VMs within the same tier or role should go into the same subnet, which can be a security boundary.
trans-unit.target: All VMs within the same tier or role should go into the same subnet, which can be a security boundary.

trans-unit.source: Use a **[Network security group][nsg]** (NSG) on the subnet for the data tier, so that only the business tier and the jumpbox can send traffic to the data tier.
trans-unit.target: Use a **[Network security group][nsg]** (NSG) on the subnet for the data tier, so that only the business tier and the jumpbox can send traffic to the data tier.

trans-unit.source: Load balancers.
trans-unit.target: Load balancers.

trans-unit.source: Use an [Internet-facing load balancer][load-balancer-external] to distribute incoming Internet traffic to the web tier, and an [internal load balancer][load-balancer-internal] to distribute network traffic from the web tier to the business tier.
trans-unit.target: Use an [Internet-facing load balancer][load-balancer-external] to distribute incoming Internet traffic to the web tier, and an [internal load balancer][load-balancer-internal] to distribute network traffic from the web tier to the business tier.

trans-unit.source: **Jumpbox**.
trans-unit.target: **Jumpbox**.

trans-unit.source: A _jumpbox_, also called a [bastion host], is a VM on the network that administrators use to connect to the other VMs.
trans-unit.target: A _jumpbox_, also called a [bastion host], is a VM on the network that administrators use to connect to the other VMs.

trans-unit.source: The jumpbox has an NSG that allows remote desktop (RDP) only from whitelisted public IP addresses.
trans-unit.target: The jumpbox has an NSG that allows remote desktop (RDP) only from whitelisted public IP addresses.

trans-unit.source: **[Azure Key Vault][azure-key-vault]** securely stores encryption keys, application secrets, and certificates.
trans-unit.target: **[Azure Key Vault][azure-key-vault]** securely stores encryption keys, application secrets, and certificates.

trans-unit.source: Network recommendations
trans-unit.target: Network recommendations

trans-unit.source: VNet / Subnets
trans-unit.target: VNet / Subnets

trans-unit.source: When you create the VNet, specify the address range and subnet mask using [CIDR] notation.
trans-unit.target: When you create the VNet, specify the address range and subnet mask using [CIDR] notation.

trans-unit.source: The address space must fall within the standard [private IP address ranges][rfc1918].
trans-unit.target: The address space must fall within the standard [private IP address ranges][rfc1918].

trans-unit.source: Make sure to allocate enough address space for the subnets you will need.
trans-unit.target: Make sure to allocate enough address space for the subnets you will need.

trans-unit.source: A reasonable default is 10.0.0.0/16.
trans-unit.target: A reasonable default is 10.0.0.0/16.

trans-unit.source: When you create a subnet, specify the address space for the subnet in CIDR notation.
trans-unit.target: When you create a subnet, specify the address space for the subnet in CIDR notation.

trans-unit.source: For example, '10.0.0.0/24' creates a range of 256 IP addresses.
trans-unit.target: For example, '10.0.0.0/24' creates a range of 256 IP addresses.

trans-unit.source: (VMs can use 251 of these; five are reserved.
trans-unit.target: (VMs can use 251 of these; five are reserved.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the [Virtual Network FAQ][vnet faq].) Make sure the address ranges don't overlap across subnets.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the [Virtual Network FAQ][vnet faq].) Make sure the address ranges don't overlap across subnets.

trans-unit.source: Load balancers
trans-unit.target: Load balancers

trans-unit.source: The external load balancer distributes Internet traffic to the web tier.
trans-unit.target: The external load balancer distributes Internet traffic to the web tier.

trans-unit.source: Create a public IP address for this load balancer.
trans-unit.target: Create a public IP address for this load balancer.

trans-unit.source: Example:
trans-unit.target: Example:

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Get started creating an Internet facing load balancer using Azure CLI][load-balancer-external-cli]
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Get started creating an Internet facing load balancer using Azure CLI][load-balancer-external-cli]

trans-unit.source: The internal load balancer distributes network traffic from the web tier to the business tier.
trans-unit.target: The internal load balancer distributes network traffic from the web tier to the business tier.

trans-unit.source: To give this load balancer a private IP address, create a frontend IP configuration and associate it with the subnet for the business tier.
trans-unit.target: To give this load balancer a private IP address, create a frontend IP configuration and associate it with the subnet for the business tier.

trans-unit.source: Example:
trans-unit.target: Example:

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Get started creating an internal load balancer using the Azure CLI][load-balancer-internal-cli].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Get started creating an internal load balancer using the Azure CLI][load-balancer-internal-cli].

trans-unit.source: Jumpbox
trans-unit.target: Jumpbox

trans-unit.source: Use a small VM size for the jumpbox, such as Standard A1.
trans-unit.target: Use a small VM size for the jumpbox, such as Standard A1.

trans-unit.source: The jumpbox is a single VM, so don't put it in an Availability Set.
trans-unit.target: The jumpbox is a single VM, so don't put it in an Availability Set.

trans-unit.source: The jumpbox belongs to the same VNet as the other VMs, and connects to them through their private IP addresses.
trans-unit.target: The jumpbox belongs to the same VNet as the other VMs, and connects to them through their private IP addresses.

trans-unit.source: Place the jumpbox in a separate subnet, and create a [public IP address] for the jumpbox.
trans-unit.target: Place the jumpbox in a separate subnet, and create a [public IP address] for the jumpbox.

trans-unit.source: To secure the jumpbox, create an NSG and apply it to jumpbox subnet.
trans-unit.target: To secure the jumpbox, create an NSG and apply it to jumpbox subnet.

trans-unit.source: Add a NAT rule that allows remote desktop (RDP) only from a whitelisted set of public IP addresses.
trans-unit.target: Add a NAT rule that allows remote desktop (RDP) only from a whitelisted set of public IP addresses.

trans-unit.source: The NSG can be attached either to the subnet or to the jumpbox NIC.
trans-unit.target: The NSG can be attached either to the subnet or to the jumpbox NIC.

trans-unit.source: In this case, we recommend attaching it to the NIC, so RDP traffic is permitted only to the jumpbox, even if you add other VMs to the same subnet.
trans-unit.target: In this case, we recommend attaching it to the NIC, so RDP traffic is permitted only to the jumpbox, even if you add other VMs to the same subnet.

trans-unit.source: Availability
trans-unit.target: Availability

trans-unit.source: Put each tier or VM role into a separate Availability Set.
trans-unit.target: Put each tier or VM role into a separate Availability Set.

trans-unit.source: If you place two different tiers in the same Availability Set, all the VMs for one tier could get rebooted at once, during [planned maintenance][vm-planned-maintenance].
trans-unit.target: If you place two different tiers in the same Availability Set, all the VMs for one tier could get rebooted at once, during [planned maintenance][vm-planned-maintenance].

trans-unit.source: The availability SLA for the VMs does not automatically translate into a highly available database.
trans-unit.target: The availability SLA for the VMs does not automatically translate into a highly available database.

trans-unit.source: Design your database tier for reliability by using replication and failover.
trans-unit.target: Design your database tier for reliability by using replication and failover.

trans-unit.source: Typically the business tier connects to a primary database.
trans-unit.target: Typically the business tier connects to a primary database.

trans-unit.source: If that VM goes down, the application fails over to a secondary database, either manually or automatically.
trans-unit.target: If that VM goes down, the application fails over to a secondary database, either manually or automatically.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] For SQL Server, we recommend using [AlwaysOn Availability Groups][sql-alwayson].
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] For SQL Server, we recommend using [AlwaysOn Availability Groups][sql-alwayson].

trans-unit.source: Security
trans-unit.target: Security

trans-unit.source: The data tier should only accept network traffic from the business tier and the jumpbox.
trans-unit.target: The data tier should only accept network traffic from the business tier and the jumpbox.

trans-unit.source: To enforce this restriction, create an NSG and add it to the subnet for the data tier.
trans-unit.target: To enforce this restriction, create an NSG and add it to the subnet for the data tier.

trans-unit.source: An NSG has [default rules][nsg-rules] that allow inbound traffic from within the VNet, and prohibit inbound traffic from the Internet.
trans-unit.target: An NSG has [default rules][nsg-rules] that allow inbound traffic from within the VNet, and prohibit inbound traffic from the Internet.

trans-unit.source: These rules can't be deleted, but you can override them by creating higher-priority rules.
trans-unit.target: These rules can't be deleted, but you can override them by creating higher-priority rules.

trans-unit.source: Add a rule that denies inbound traffic from the VNet.
trans-unit.target: Add a rule that denies inbound traffic from the VNet.

trans-unit.source: This rule secures the data tier from the other tiers.
trans-unit.target: This rule secures the data tier from the other tiers.

trans-unit.source: (In particular, from the web tier.)
trans-unit.target: (In particular, from the web tier.)

trans-unit.source: Add a rule with a higher priority that allows inbound traffic from the _subnet_ that contains the business tier.
trans-unit.target: Add a rule with a higher priority that allows inbound traffic from the _subnet_ that contains the business tier.

trans-unit.source: This rule enables the business to talk to the data tier.
trans-unit.target: This rule enables the business to talk to the data tier.

trans-unit.source: Add a rule that allows RDP traffic from the jumpbox subnet.
trans-unit.target: Add a rule that allows RDP traffic from the jumpbox subnet.

trans-unit.source: This rule lets administrators connect to the data tier from the jumpbox.
trans-unit.target: This rule lets administrators connect to the data tier from the jumpbox.

trans-unit.source: Do not allow RDP access from the public Internet to the VMs that run the application workload.
trans-unit.target: Do not allow RDP access from the public Internet to the VMs that run the application workload.

trans-unit.source: Instead, all RDP access to these VMs must come through the jumpbox.
trans-unit.target: Instead, all RDP access to these VMs must come through the jumpbox.

trans-unit.source: An administrator logs into the jumpbox, and then logs into the other VM from the jumpbox.
trans-unit.target: An administrator logs into the jumpbox, and then logs into the other VM from the jumpbox.

trans-unit.source: The jumpbox allows RDP traffic from the Internet, but only from known, whitelisted IP addresses.
trans-unit.target: The jumpbox allows RDP traffic from the Internet, but only from known, whitelisted IP addresses.

trans-unit.source: Encrypt data at rest.
trans-unit.target: Encrypt data at rest.

trans-unit.source: Use [Azure Key Vault][azure-key-vault] to store encryption keys.
trans-unit.target: Use [Azure Key Vault][azure-key-vault] to store encryption keys.

trans-unit.source: It's also recommended to store application secrets, such as database connection strings, in Key Vault.
trans-unit.target: It's also recommended to store application secrets, such as database connection strings, in Key Vault.

trans-unit.source: Scalability
trans-unit.target: Scalability

trans-unit.source: The load balancers distribute network traffic to the web and business tiers.
trans-unit.target: The load balancers distribute network traffic to the web and business tiers.

trans-unit.source: Scale horizontally by adding new VM instances.
trans-unit.target: Scale horizontally by adding new VM instances.

trans-unit.source: Note that you can scale the web and data tiers independently, based on load.
trans-unit.target: Note that you can scale the web and data tiers independently, based on load.

trans-unit.source: To reduce possible complications caused by the need to maintain client affinity, the VMs in the web tier should be stateless.
trans-unit.target: To reduce possible complications caused by the need to maintain client affinity, the VMs in the web tier should be stateless.

trans-unit.source: The VMs hosting the business logic should also be stateless.
trans-unit.target: The VMs hosting the business logic should also be stateless.

trans-unit.source: Manageability
trans-unit.target: Manageability

trans-unit.source: Individual VMs should have diagnostics enabled to provide health and performance data.
trans-unit.target: Individual VMs should have diagnostics enabled to provide health and performance data.

trans-unit.source: Examine the [audit logs][azure-audit-logs] to view provisioning actions and other events.
trans-unit.target: Examine the [audit logs][azure-audit-logs] to view provisioning actions and other events.

trans-unit.source: Simplify management of the entire system by using centralized administration tools such as [Azure Automation][azure-administration], [Microsoft Operations Management Suite][operations-management-suite], [Chef][chef], or [Puppet][puppet].
trans-unit.target: Simplify management of the entire system by using centralized administration tools such as [Azure Automation][azure-administration], [Microsoft Operations Management Suite][operations-management-suite], [Chef][chef], or [Puppet][puppet].

trans-unit.source: These tools can consolidate diagnostic and health information captured from multiple VMs to provide an overall view of the system.
trans-unit.target: These tools can consolidate diagnostic and health information captured from multiple VMs to provide an overall view of the system.

trans-unit.source: Example deployment script
trans-unit.target: Example deployment script

trans-unit.source: The following Windows batch script executes the [Azure CLI][azure-cli] commands to deploy multiple VMs and the related network and storage resources, as shown in the previous diagram.
trans-unit.target: The following Windows batch script executes the [Azure CLI][azure-cli] commands to deploy multiple VMs and the related network and storage resources, as shown in the previous diagram.

trans-unit.source: The script uses the naming conventions described in [Recommended Naming Conventions for Azure Resources][naming conventions].
trans-unit.target: The script uses the naming conventions described in [Recommended Naming Conventions for Azure Resources][naming conventions].
